metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition

requirements.description: This Section applies to the application of cladding to the exterior of buildings
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to the application of cladding to the exterior of buildings

requirements.description: Cladding shall protect the building from rain penetration by providing a first plane of protection together with a second plane of protection where required
requirements.exact_quote: Cladding shall protect the building from rain penetration by providing a first plane of protection together with a second plane of protection where required

requirements.description: Second plane of protection requirements shall conform to Article 9.27.3.1
requirements.exact_quote: Second plane of protection requirements shall conform to Article 9.27.3.1

requirements.description: Exterior cladding shall be installed not less than 150 mm above finished ground level
requirements.exact_quote: Exterior cladding other than masonry veneer and concrete shall be installed not less than 150 mm above finished ground level

requirements.description: Masonry veneer and concrete shall be installed not less than 200 mm above finished ground level
requirements.exact_quote: Masonry veneer and concrete shall be installed not less than 200 mm above finished ground level

requirements.description: Clearance above paved surfaces may be reduced to 50 mm where paved surface slopes away from building
requirements.exact_quote: The clearance above finished ground level required in Sentences (1) and (2) may be reduced to not less than 50 mm where a paved surface slopes away from the building

requirements.description: Flashings shall be installed at the base of cladding, at projections, and at intersections with roofs and decks
requirements.exact_quote: Flashings shall be installed at the base of cladding, at projections, and at intersections with roofs and decks

requirements.description: Stucco shall conform to the requirements of CSA A179
requirements.exact_quote: Stucco shall conform to the requirements of CSA A179

requirements.description: Stucco may be applied directly to masonry, concrete, or unit masonry
requirements.exact_quote: Stucco may be applied directly to masonry, concrete, or unit masonry

requirements.description: On wood-frame and steel-frame construction, stucco shall be applied over self-furring metal lath conforming to ASTM C847
requirements.exact_quote: On wood-frame and steel-frame construction, stucco shall be applied over self-furring metal lath conforming to ASTM C847

requirements.description: Minimum stucco thickness on frame construction shall be 17 mm
requirements.exact_quote: The thickness of stucco on frame construction shall be not less than 17 mm

requirements.description: Minimum stucco thickness on masonry or concrete shall be 13 mm
requirements.exact_quote: The thickness of stucco on masonry or concrete shall be not less than 13 mm

requirements.description: Control joints shall be provided in stucco at intervals not exceeding 18 m2 of wall area
requirements.exact_quote: Control joints shall be provided in stucco at intervals not exceeding 18 m2 of wall area

requirements.description: Vinyl siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-41.24-M
requirements.exact_quote: Vinyl siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-41.24-M

requirements.description: Metal siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M
requirements.exact_quote: Metal siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.3-M

requirements.description: Vinyl and metal siding shall be applied over sheathing conforming to Section 9.23
requirements.exact_quote: Vinyl and metal siding shall be applied over sheathing conforming to Section 9.23

requirements.description: Hardboard siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.3-M
requirements.exact_quote: Hardboard siding shall conform to CAN/CGSB-11.3-M

requirements.description: Minimum thickness for hardboard lap siding shall be 6.4 mm
requirements.exact_quote: Hardboard lap siding shall be not less than 6.4 mm thick

requirements.description: Minimum lap for hardboard horizontal lap siding
requirements.exact_quote: Hardboard horizontal lap siding shall be lapped not less than 25 mm

requirements.description: Wood shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1
requirements.exact_quote: Wood shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1

requirements.description: Maximum exposure for No. 1 Grade wood shingles used as siding
requirements.exact_quote: The maximum exposure for No. 1 Grade wood shingles used as siding shall be 190 mm

requirements.description: Maximum exposure for No. 1 Grade shakes used as siding (610 mm length)
requirements.exact_quote: The maximum exposure for No. 1 Grade shakes, 610 mm in length, used as siding shall be 300 mm

requirements.description: Each shingle or shake shall be fastened with not less than 2 corrosion-resistant nails
requirements.exact_quote: Each shingle or shake shall be fastened with not less than 2 corrosion-resistant nails

requirements.description: Minimum thickness for board siding
requirements.exact_quote: Board siding shall be not less than 17 mm thick

requirements.description: Minimum overlap for horizontal bevel siding
requirements.exact_quote: Horizontal bevel siding shall be lapped not less than 25 mm

requirements.description: Minimum overlap for battens over board joints
requirements.exact_quote: Battens shall overlap board joints by not less than 12 mm on each side

requirements.description: Plywood siding shall conform to CSA O121 or CSA O151
requirements.exact_quote: Plywood siding shall conform to CSA O121 or CSA O151

requirements.description: Minimum plywood siding thickness where studs are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
requirements.exact_quote: Plywood siding shall be not less than 7.5 mm thick where studs are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.

requirements.description: Minimum plywood siding thickness where studs are spaced more than 400 mm but not more than 600 mm o.c.
requirements.exact_quote: 9.5 mm thick where studs are spaced more than 400 mm but not more than 600 mm o.c.

requirements.description: Horizontal joints in plywood siding shall be flashed or protected by battens or metal Z-flashing
requirements.exact_quote: Horizontal joints in plywood siding shall be flashed or protected by battens or metal Z-flashing

requirements.description: Vertical joints shall occur over framing members and be caulked, covered with battens, or shiplapped
requirements.exact_quote: Vertical joints shall occur over framing members and be caulked, covered with battens, or shiplapped
